SWADETOOLS.RemStunnedSuc: is no longer Stunned, but still Vulnerable
SWADETOOLS.RemStunnedRaise: is no longer Stunned, but still Vulnerable until the end of his turn
SWADETOOLS.ItsBound: is Bound, can't move and can only try to break free using Athletics or Strength-2
SWADETOOLS.ItsEntangled: is Entangled and can't move, but can try to break free with an action using Athletics or Strength-2
SWADETOOLS.NoweaponInActor: Your controlled Actor does not have an item named
SWADETOOLS.NoskillInActor: Your controlled Actor does not have a skill named
SWADETOOLS.NopowerInActor: Your controlled Actor does not have a power named
SWADETOOLS.NoActorFound: No Actor was found. Select a Token.
SWADETOOLS.NoActorFoundReroll: No Actor was found to spend the Benny (or there are actors with the same name), spend the benny and reroll manually
SWADETOOLS.AutoInitWarn: This is enabled by default when using SWADE Tools, but it's disabled in the system configs to avoid conflict
SWADETOOLS.SettingFightingHint: Skill name to use for calculate Parry and determine if target will be hit based on Parry (in most cases, leave as it is).
SWADETOOLS.SettingUseShotsHint: If you don't want to automatically track shots when using weapons, disable this.
SWADETOOLS.SettingUsePPHint: If you don't want to automatically track power points when using powers, disable this.
SWADETOOLS.TargetsTitleDamage: Targets: click to apply damage (only GM)
SWADETOOLS.OnlyGM: Only GM has permission to do this
SWADETOOLS.PermissionActor: You don't have permission to use this Actor (or his functionality)
SWADETOOLS.NotShaken: The Actor is not Shaken anymore
SWADETOOLS.PPHint: PP to be added to cost. Can be negative.
SWADETOOLS.NoItemEquipped: No item equipped on selected token
SWADETOOLS.TipRofRoll: For RoF, hit/raise are defined manually
SWADETOOLS.TipTargetNumber: (N) is the target number (visible to GM only)
SWADETOOLS.SettingsItemNameClick: Show info when clicking on weapon/power/skill name
SWADETOOLS.SettingsItemNameClickHint: This will keep the default behaviour on click of a power/weapon/skill name (normally show some info), instead of opening a dialog to roll.
SWADETOOLS.SettingsDefaultStatus: Use system default status icons when available
SWADETOOLS.SettingsDefaultStatusHint: Enable this to use the system default status icons instead of Swade Tools icons.
SWADETOOLS.SettingsJokersWildHint: This will disable automatic benny distribution when drawing a Joker in combat.
SWADETOOLS.ConvEnd: Your Convinction is running out. You might spend a Benny to keep it until the next round.
SWADETOOLS.AlreadyConvic: This actor already has Conviction active
SWADETOOLS.ConvictionKept: Conviction was extended to the next round!
SWADETOOLS.settingNameHint: Change the default names that affect rolls automatically (abilities are considered as edge items). If you using SWADE core in a SWADE TOOLS supported language, you probably won't need to change anything here.
SWADETOOLS.HardyWarn: has Hardy, so no effect on another Shaken result
SWADETOOLS.settingRulesHint: Mark the Setting Rules you are using to change configuration and automation.
SWADETOOLS.HardChoicesWarn: When using Hard Choices, NPC WildCard bennies will be ignored. Do you want to also disable Joker's Wild and set starting GM Bennies to zero? This is the default for Hard Choices.
SWADETOOLS.ConfigDisabled: configuration was disabled to avoid conflict with Swade Tools
SWADETOOLS.ConfigEnabled: configuration was enabled automatically by Swade Tools
SWADETOOLS.FightingWarn: was modified from Fighting according to your Swade Tools settings to:
SWADETOOLS.SettingsAutoInitStart: Don't roll initiative automatically when a starting a combat
SWADETOOLS.SettingsAutoInitStartHint: (Requires Reload) Disable the automatic initative roll when starting a combat.
SWADETOOLS.AutoDisableWarn: If checked, Swade Tools will not enable the following SWADE system setting automatically at start:
SWADETOOLS.OutOfControlRoll: tries to avoid Out of Control
SWADETOOLS.OutOfControlTableHint: Choose a table to roll automatically when a vehicle suffers from Out of Control
SWADETOOLS.GrittyDamageHint: Choose a table to roll for Gritty Damage
SWADETOOLS.NoOperatorSkill: No Operation Skill found in this Vehicle
SWADETOOLS.UpdateSWADE: Your SWADE system version is not compatible with SWADE Tools module. Please update SWADE system.
SWADETOOLS.TipRoFLower: When using RoF, the lower result is ignored.
SWADETOOLS.ActDmgHint: Damage to be rolled when clicking Hit/Raise
SWADETOOLS.NoDmgActionDefined: There's no damage defined in this item's action. The default damage was used (if defined).
SWADETOOLS.NoSkillQuestion: don't have a skill. Would you like to use one?
SWADETOOLS.RangedInMelee: Ranged Weapon in Melee: Using Parry
SWADETOOLS.SettingGangUp: Calculate GangUp (create friendly PCs and hostile NPCs)
SWADETOOLS.SettingGangUpHint: Using this option, Gang Up will be calculated automatically. New Characters (PC) will be marked as friendly in Token configurations and NPCs as hostile (you can alter this later, like in a NPC ally). If you want to fix all the current Actors, use the macro: PC Friendly / NPC Hostile
SWADETOOLS.FriendlyPCMacroQuestion: This will turn all current characters (PCs) as friendly and NPCs as hostile in Prototype Token configurations. Proceed?
SWADETOOLS.FriendlyPCMacroOk: All current PCs are friendly and NPCs hostile in Prototype Token!
SWADETOOLS.SettingShowSituational: Always show Situational Modifiers for target
SWADETOOLS.SettingShowSituationalHint: With this option checked, targets' modifiers will be always visible, no need to click at (?)
SWADETOOLS.settingCustomHint: Change the default SWADE Tools to work better with the way you play.
SWADETOOLS.StatusIconsSettingHint: Change to  the default Status icons from the system ou deactivate the icons.
SWADETOOLS.SettingNoAutoRollHint: (Requires Reload) This option disables automatic rolls to remove Stun or Shaken during combat.
SWADETOOLS.SettinguseScaleHint: Calculate Scale modifiers in attacks. Creatures with Swat (special ability) will show a checkbox in their attack
SWADETOOLS.SettingreloadXHint: Shows a button to reload a specific number of bullets instead of the full reload.
SWADETOOLS.SettingsSimpleRollsHint: This option will simplify trait rolls showing only a field for a custom modifier
SWADETOOLS.SettingWildAttackSkills: Skills to use for Wild/Desperate Attack
SWADETOOLS.SettingWildAttackSkillsHint: List of skills to use for Wild/Desperate Attack, separated by comma. Ex: Fighting, Athtletics, Shooting
SWADETOOLS.SettingAskCalledShotsHint: This option shows a select for called shots when using attack items
SWADETOOLS.CalledShotHint: Penalties are added automatically, add extra modifiers manually. Head shots apply +4 damage.
SWADETOOLS.SettingShootingHint: Skill to use for Shooting based Edges.
SWADETOOLS.NotBelowd4: can't have a trait below d4
SWADETOOLS.BoostLowerHint: Use negative number to Lower Trait
SWADETOOLS.DurationHint: Leave it blank for no duration
SWADETOOLS.BoostSkill: will be added with a [Boost] marker for
SWADETOOLS.SelectModifiersHint: Shows a pre-defined selection of modifiers for Multi-Action, Cover and Illumination
SWADETOOLS.SettingDesperateAttackHint: Add a field for Desperate Attack (as in Pathfinder Setting). This field will be shown for the same skills defined for Wild Attack
SWADETOOLS.HeavyArmorWarn: Target has Heavy Armor, only affected by Heavy Weapon
SWADETOOLS.ArcaneDevicePPHint: The full cost in PP to activate the device
SWADETOOLS.SettingnoWoundFatigueIcon: Don't show Wounds/Fatigue counter over token
SWADETOOLS.SettingautoCoverHint: This option will automatically count Cover penalty for equipped Shields (or any item with cover) on Ranged Attacks .
SWADETOOLS.SettingonlySystemMod: Use only Soak and Unshaken bonus defined by the sheet tweaks.
SWADETOOLS.SettingonlySystemModHint: Check this option if you want to use only the sheet tweak bonus for Unshaken and Soak. This will disable auto-detection of some edges and abilities like: Combat Reflexes, Undead, etc.
SWADETOOLS.SettingsUseGroupRolls: Show Group Roll option for Extras
SWADETOOLS.SettingsUseGroupRollsHint: If this is checked, a Group Roll checkbox will appear for Extras, adding a wild die.
SWADETOOLS.bloodAndGoreRiftsHint: If an attacker with Heavy Weapon causes a wound in a opponent without Heavy Armor it'll automatically roll on the Injury Table. You have to define a Injury Table in the system configuration.
